p: Kremer et al. [ 8] conducted a study on related species M. kerneri and M. juliana in several locations in the Balkans, including Croatia, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Montenegro, Republic of Macedonia, and Northern Greece, locations that are geographically similar and relatively close to the collection sites of M. frivaldszkyana in this study. The two Micromeria species from the above locations did not contain pulegone, menthone, or neomenthol, the major EO constituents of M. frivaldszkyana in this study. The limonene concentration in M. kerneri and M. juliana varied from 0% to 5.4%, while germacrene varied from 1.5% to 4.9% in the EO of the two species.
